intro: Anthistiria mutica, commonly known as the silky anthistiria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, silvery-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft, velvety appearance. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Anthistiria mutica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
